intro: Ranunculus chongzhouensis, commonly known as the Chongzhou buttercup, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes various flowering plants known for their showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and vibrant yellow or white flowers with numerous petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions and forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
